titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1469) making emergency supplemental appropriations for recovery from natural disasters, and for overseas peacekeeping efforts, including those in Bosnia, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1997, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-96, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1469 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against consideration of the bill shall be waived. Bill is open to amendments. The amendment printed in part 1 of the report accompanying this resolution and an amendment striking lines 8 through 17 on page 24 shall be considered as adopted in the House and the Committee of the Whole. Before consideration of any other amendment it shall be in order to consider the amendments printed in part 2 of the report accompanying this resolution in the order and manner specified in the report. All points of order against the amendments shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 33.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 193 - 229 (Roll no. 125).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/13/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 1469 (emergency supplemental appropriations).
